title: Nothing OS 3 Finally Begins its Stable Roll-out
description: More phones will receive the update soon. The post Nothing OS 3 Finally Begins its Stable Roll-out appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: More phones will receive the update soon.
text: Following the arrival of Nothing OS 3’s beta version for several Nothing handsets (including the CMF Phone), it looks like the update’s stable version has finally started to arrive for a handful of devices, which include the Nothing Phone 2 and Nothing Phone 2a. READ: Nothing could have a trio of new phones in the works for the first half of 2025 The company says that it will gradually roll out the software upgrade to more phones. As such, the Nothing Phone 1, Phone 2a Plus and CMF Phone 1 will receive the update, which is based on Android 15. Nothing OS 3 includes new features such as a dedicated Nothing Gallery app with new search and editing tools, a redesigned lock screen with added customizability, shared widgets, a countdown widget, and an AI-based smart drawer for app categorization. Other changes include improvements to Quick Settings and pop-up view, tweaks to Nothing OS’ typography, and other general enhancements. You can check for updates via the Settings app on your Nothing Phone. Source: GSMArena
